shell.distance

Class GMapShell

  • java.lang.Object
    • shell.distance.GMapShell

  • public class GMapShell
extends java.lang.Object
    Sends queries to Google Distance Matrix API and Google Geocoding API, and receives response values in return. In order to use this program, you need a developer account on Google API Console, and one API key to pass as a value for the apiKey parameter. To get this source code compiled, follow the instructions in ReadMe.html
    Since:
    24/02/2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nguyen V. Tan

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Executes this program by this following command: java -cp $CLASSPATH:$main_jarfile shell.distance.GMapShell --$OPTIONS value(s); whereas $CLASSPATH contains all required .jar files okhttp-2.2.0.jar gson-2.3.1.jar joda-time-2.7.jar LIBS_PATH/gmapservice.jar LIBS_PATHokio.jar $main_jarfile and $main_jarfile is the actual .jar file (in the current version (since February 2015, it's called gshellmap.jar) which contains shell/distance.GMapShell.class.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes this program by this following command: java -cp $CLASSPATH:$main_jarfile shell.distance.GMapShell --$OPTIONS value(s); whereas $CLASSPATH contains all required .jar files
        • okhttp-2.2.0.jar
        • gson-2.3.1.jar
        • joda-time-2.7.jar
        • LIBS_PATH/gmapservice.jar
        • LIBS_PATHokio.jar
        • $main_jarfile
        and $main_jarfile is the actual .jar file (in the current version (since February 2015, it's called gshellmap.jar) which contains shell/distance.GMapShell.class. As this document implies (-cp $CLASSPATH:$main_jarfile), $main_jarfile must be added to the $CLASSPATH, since this .jar file contains more than one main class, and it's not a directly executable .jar file. For help, type --help right after the class name (in this case "shell.distance.GMapShell") If you want to, you can use these following $OPTIONS:
        --help
        --language determines the response language
        --unit IMPERIAL (in feet or miles)|METRIC (in metres or kilometres)
        --mode determines the way of travel (driving|walking|bicycling|transit) --fuzzy false|true:
        determines whether the user wants to enter simple names of places (details like street number, or postal code are not required), or detailed address information. if fuzzy is false, the user will have to give geographic data like
        • country
        • town
        • postal code
        • street
        • street number
        --routes false|true:
        if set to true, all routes from the start address to the end address are listed.
